text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to identify UK civil litigation rules as including proportional pre-trial discovery. The candidate answer states under Section 1.A (Procedural Risks, Discovery & Evidence) for the UK: '- Limited pre-trial discovery (CPR 31).'. CPR Part 31 governs disclosure (the UK equivalent of discovery), and the overriding objective of the Civil Procedure Rules (CPR) emphasizes proportionality, which governs the scope of disclosure. Therefore, the response correctly identifies the relevant procedural framework (CPR 31) which inherently includes proportionality.", "criterion_id": "92b58255-0bf8-4690-99a4-55e9abe78dd9"}
